visuals.title: Tweets of the world
visuals.description:
This is an experiment based on random tweets I gathered through Twitter's API https://dev.twitter.com/docs/api/1/get/statuses/sample

controls: 
- left click: zoom in
- right click: zoom out
- drag the map once zoomed in
- mouse overs the dots: display the tweets' message and country

When translating this sketch from 'regular' Processing to ProcessingJS, I had many issues, including:
- map() does not work (!?)
- PGraphics.clear() does not work (!?)
- mouseDragged() is called as soon as mousePressed is called (!?)
- simple loops such as for(Tweet tweet in tweets) don't work (!?)

visuals.title: Tweets of the 3D world
visuals.description:
This is a port of my previous 2D sketch towards a 3D view. Only works on Chrome online.

controls:
- drag the mouse to rotate the Earth
- mouse over the tweets to display their message/country
- mouse wheel should zoom in/out, but if not you can press up/down keys

Once again, it is very limited by Processing JS... It turns out that:
- no fill() can be used in the whole code, otherwise the texture shall apply it as well no matter what
- hint(DISABLE_DEPTH_TEST) also messes with the texture rendering, it is unusable in my case. This leads to a bad text display, I know ^^

visuals.title: Fluid Simulation + Momentum Transfer + Electrostatic Force
visuals.description:
Mouse-interactive fluid simulation with particles.
The fluid simulation is solved on a 16x16 cell grid.
Using Verlet integration for the particle update.
Every particle has an electric charge and two of them have a static value. When any two  particles collide, they equally share it. The border is the electric ground. There's a nonlinear friction and on every collision there's a tiny amount of 1% energy lost, so its passive state approaches a global lower limit energy.
So far, the binding of the forces is one-way only and the particle motion doesn't add to the fluid simulation.
Have fun!

visuals.title: Fluid Simulation + Momentum Transfer + Electrostatic Force
visuals.description:
Mouse-interactive fluid simulation with particles.
The fluid simulation is solved on a 16x16 cell grid.
Using Verlet integration for the particle update.
Every particle has an electric charge and two of them have a static value. When any two  particles collide, they equally share it. The border is the electric ground. There's a nonlinear friction and on every collision there's a tiny amount of 1% energy lost, so its passive state approaches a global lower limit energy.
So far, the binding of the forces is one-way only and the particle motion doesn't add to the fluid simulation.
Have fun!

visuals.title: Tiling
visuals.description:
Left click to increase the number of tiles, right click to reduce. Space bar to save the picture. Number keys (1,2,3,4,5,6) to perform the following rules (at the limited resolution of 800x800, get code and modify to get higher res).
Rule 1: Randomized selection of the two tiles.
Rule 2: If the position of the tile is (x,y), then is x+y even or odd?
Rule 3: Is x*y even or odd?
Rule 4: Is sin(x+y)>0?
Rule 5: Is x>y?
Rule 6: Is x^y even or odd?

visuals.title: Windy Collatz Conjecture Tree
visuals.description: A visualization of the tree generated by the Collatz Conjecture, with a wind simulation. The Collatz Conjecture does this: For a number n, if n is even, divide by two; if n is odd, multiply by three and add 1. This forms a tree because every number ends up at one. Inspired by Daniel Shiffman's newest coding challenge on Youtube.

visuals.title: Tweets of the world
visuals.description:
This is an experiment based on random tweets I gathered through Twitter's API https://dev.twitter.com/docs/api/1/get/statuses/sample

controls: 
- left click: zoom in
- right click: zoom out
- drag the map once zoomed in
- mouse overs the dots: display the tweets' message and country

When translating this sketch from 'regular' Processing to ProcessingJS, I had many issues, including:
- map() does not work (!?)
- PGraphics.clear() does not work (!?)
- mouseDragged() is called as soon as mousePressed is called (!?)
- simple loops such as for(Tweet tweet in tweets) don't work (!?)

visuals.title: Tweets of the 3D world
visuals.description:
This is a port of my previous 2D sketch towards a 3D view. Only works on Chrome online.

controls:
- drag the mouse to rotate the Earth
- mouse over the tweets to display their message/country
- mouse wheel should zoom in/out, but if not you can press up/down keys

Once again, it is very limited by Processing JS... It turns out that:
- no fill() can be used in the whole code, otherwise the texture shall apply it as well no matter what
- hint(DISABLE_DEPTH_TEST) also messes with the texture rendering, it is unusable in my case. This leads to a bad text display, I know ^^
